title: England v South Africa: Women’s Cricket World Cup semi-final – live
summary: England faces South Africa in a crucial match for a place in the Women's Cricket World Cup final in India. The match is covered with live over-by-over commentary from the writers. Excitement builds as both teams compete for a chance at the championship.

title: Australia v India: first men’s Twenty20 international – live
summary: The five-match T20 series begins in Canberra with the tourists batting first. Martin Pegan will provide updates throughout the match. Keep an eye on the over-by-over report for live insights.

title: Trump says he will cut fentanyl tariff on Chinese goods and expects ‘great deal’ with Xi – business live
summary: Asian stock markets experienced a rally due to optimism surrounding trade deals, with investors feeling hopeful about potential progress. The positive sentiment was further bolstered by expectations of an impending interest rate cut by the US Federal Reserve. This combination of factors contributed to a generally upbeat market atmosphere across the region.

title: Aston Martin cuts investment plan by £300m as Trump tariffs bite
summary: The carmaker reported third-quarter losses of £112 million, exceeding expectations. The decline reflects weak demand in China, contributing to the financial setback. This result highlights ongoing challenges faced by the company in the global market.

title: Shabana Mahmood admits Home Office not yet up to dealing with all the challenges it is facing – UK politics live
summary: The Home Secretary has acknowledged ongoing issues within her department, indicating it is not operating effectively. She emphasized the need for improvements to ensure better performance. The admission reflects challenges in delivering essential services.
